SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class Key

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.Key
Direct Known Subclasses:
PrivateKey, PublicKey
public abstract class Key extends Object
This abstract class provides a foundational representation of an RSA key, encapsulating common attributes and behaviors such as parsing, storing, and retrieving a key or its components. It provides methods to load the key from a file or initialise it directly using a string representation. This class is intended to be subclassed to create concrete (public or private) key representations.

  • Constructor Details

    • Key

      public Key(String key)
      Constructs key using a comma-delimited string representation of the key containing the modulus followed by the exponent. This constructor initialises the key's value and parses the modulus and exponent.
      Parameters:
      key - The string representation of the key.

    • Key

      public Key(File keyFile) throws IOException
      Constructs key by reading string representation from a file before initialising the key's value and parsing the modulus and exponent.
      Parameters:
      keyFile - The file from which to read the key.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the key file.

    • Key

      public Key(BigInteger modulus, BigInteger exponent)
      Constructs an RSA key with the given modulus and exponent.
      Parameters:
      modulus - The modulus part of the key.
      exponent - The exponent part of the key.

  • Method Details

    • checkValidKeyComponents

      protected void checkValidKeyComponents(BigInteger modulus, BigInteger exponent)
      Validates the modulus and exponent components of the public key to ensure they are not null and are positive integers.
      Parameters:
      modulus - the modulus component of the public key.
      exponent - the exponent component of the public key.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either the modulus or the exponent is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if either the modulus or the exponent is less than or equal to 0.

    • parseKeyValue

      protected void parseKeyValue(String keyValue)
      Parses the string representation of the key to extract the modulus and exponent.
      Parameters:
      keyValue - The string representation of the key.

    • getExponent

      Gets the exponent of this key.

    • exportKey

      public void exportKey(String fileName) throws IOException
      Exports the key to a file with a specified file name. If a file with the same name already * exists, a number suffix will be added to the file name to avoid overwriting the existing file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to which the key should be exported.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing the key to the file.
